greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of lattice paths from {n}^k to {0}^k using steps that decrement one component or all components by 1; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Column k is the diagonal of the rational function 1 / (1 - Sum_{j=1..k} x_j - Product_{j=1..k} x_j) for k>1. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 10 2020
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..44, flattened
formula: A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n} multinomial(n+(k-1)*j; n-j, {j}^k) for k>1, A(n,0) = A(n,1) = 1.
G.f. of column k: Sum_{j>=0} (k*j)!/j!^k * x^j / (1-x)^(k*j+1). for k>1. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 10 2020
mathematica: a[_, 0] = a[_, 1] = 1; a[n_, k_] := Sum[Product[Binomial[n+j*m, m], {j, 0, k-1}], {m, 0, n}]; Table[a[n-k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 11 2013 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 23 2013
